title: Uber Fourth-Quarter Revenue Jumps as Customers Go Out, Keep Ordering In
sub_head: Ride-hailing company sees gross bookings continuing to climb in first three months of this year
body:
Uber Technologies Inc.â€™s revenue climbed 83% in the last quarter of 2021, helped by a recovery in its rides business and continued demand for food delivery despite restaurant reopenings.
The company posted revenue of $5.78 billion for the three months ended Dec. 31, beating the average estimate of $5.35 billion from analysts polled by FactSet. Its rides bookings rose by 67% year-over-year while its food-delivery bookings jumped 34% over the same period. Uber ended the quarter with 118 million active customers, a record for the company.
